titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Drama Library, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:44

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The materials consist of correspondence, gift records, accession records, and annual reports.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 32-D (YRG32-D), Records of Yale school and departmental libraries and collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Drama Library, 2009.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is partially restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Drama Library, Yale University, Records (RU 1086). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Drama Library began in 1925 when the Department of Drama (later School of Drama) was founded by George Pierce Baker. During most of its history it was located in the University Theatre building at 222 York Street. In August of 2008 it joined the collections housed in the Haas Family Arts Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of correspondence, gift records, accession records, and annual reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials older than 35 years are open; remainder of material restricted 35 years from date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of accession records, annual reports, and correspondence.

did.unittitle: Audio-Visual Cassette and Disc Accession Book

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted to office of origin only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of correspondence and related materials documenting gifts to the Drama Library.
